thread.title: Newcastle East constituency General Election results 2017: Full standings, MP and reaction

author: Simon Meechan
title: Newcastle East constituency General Election results 2017: Full standings, MP and reaction

organizations.name: labour - nick brown newcastle east mp nick brown  nick brown

text:
The Byker Wall housing Estate in Newcastle circa 2005 Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This page provides full information about the Newcastle East constituency including candidates standing in the General Election 2017 , history of the seat and 2015 results. 
The interactive tool and information will be updated to show General Election 2017 results once the vote count is declared. 
The polls close at 10pm on Thursday, June 8 and results start being declared around midnight, with Sunderland and Newcastle usually among the first constituencies in the country to announce. 
This page will be updated as soon as the constituency in question has declared. Read More What are the results in my constituency? 
Enter your postcode below to find out more details on your constituency. About Newcastle East 
It was formed in 2010 when Newcastle East and Wallsend ceased to exist in a boundary change, however Nick Brown was voted in again to represent the newly created Newcastle East. 
There are around 65,000 potential voters and you’re in the Newcastle East constituency if you live in Byker, Dene, North Heaton, North Jesmond, Ouseburn, South Heaton, Walker and Walkergate. The end of ship-building (a major employer) led to a long period of decline, however various regeneration projects and home building schemes are underway across the constituency. Which parties and candidates standing in Newcastle East? 
Labour - Nick Brown Newcastle East MP Nick Brown 
Nick Brown has held this seat since 1983, and celebrated his 30 years as the constituency’s MP with a shin-dig at the Jubilee Club in Walker. 
He has held various high profile positions within the Labour party, including shadow positions and post 1997, as North East Minister and Chief Whip. Before becoming an MP, He was a councillor in Newcastle and a legal adviser for the Northern region of the General and Municipal Worker’s Union. 
Nick is governor of Walker Technology College and a patron of the volunteer-run Leeds Youth Opera 
Liberal Democrat - Wendy Taylor MBE Political debate in Newcastle Irish Centre. Wendy Taylor Lib Dem (Photo: newcastle chronicle) 
Dr Wendy Taylor MBE is a long-standing member of Newcastle City Council, and has been a councillor for the Dene ward since 1988. She is a consultant in Clinical Oncology at the Northern Centre for Cancer Care in Newcastle Freeman Hospital and was awarded an MBE in the New Years honours list for political service. As an executive member of the council her areas of expertise are the environment, sustainability and transport. 
She stood in Newcastle East in both 2010 and 2015. 
Conservatives - Simon Kitchen Simon Kitchen from the Conservatives 
Former Heaton Manor pupil Simon Kitchen is the Conservatives ’ choice for Newcastle East. 
Mr Kitchen stood in Newcastle Central in 2015. He started his career in regeneration, where he evaluated poverty-tackling government programmes in the North East. 
A York University graduate, he has also worked for a dementia charity and advised on sustainable development. 
He says he will fight to make Brexit work for Newcastle’s East. 
UKIP - Tony Sanderson 
Tony Sanderson is running in Newcastle East for the UK Independence Party. 
ChronicleLive has contacted the Newcastle UKIP branch for more information about him. 
Green Party - Alistair Ford 
A researcher at Newcastle University, Alistair Ford says he is standing as he believes the Greens are the “only” party which has the policies addressing the issues faced in Newcastle. 
The scientist says a hard Brexit would be disastrous. He supports “progressive” thinking on transport, housing, energy and waste. His party is proposing a universal basic income. 
He is the chair the Newcastle branch of Tyne and Wear Public Transport User Group. 
What was the result in Newcastle East in 2015? 
Nick Brown won with 19,378 votes - a 49& share. 
Lib Dem Wendy Taylor came second, with 4,332, followed by the Conservatives. UKIP came forth and the Greens fifth. Who has won in Newcastle East before? 
Labour has held the seat since 2010, when it was reinstated after the boundary was changed to create the Newcastle East and Wallsend constituency in 1997. Nick Brown has held a seat since 1983, as either the MP for Newcastle East, or Newcastle East and Wallsend. Mike Thomas, of Labour and later the SDP, held the seat before him. The last time a Conservative was elected in Newcastle East was in 1959. Read More
